alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN FAIRFIELD, CENTRAL HOCKING AND LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 622 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Utica to near Millersport to 6 miles north of Hocking Hills State Park, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Newark, Lancaster, Heath, Logan, Granville, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Utica, Bremen, Millersport, Pleasantville, Hanover, Hocking Hills State Park, Harbor Hills, Granville South, Hide-A-Way Hills, Marne, Fairfield Beach and Thornport. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 122 and 142, and near mile marker 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
